lines.text: Dr. Herbert Lee, an American archaeologist, leads a scientific expedition into the wilds to uncover evidence of a lost race. The native queen, known as the Dragon Lady, is determined her kingdom shall not be invaded. Fang, a sinister lawless half-caste who controls half of the natives and holds the white settlers in fear, seeks the riches hidden beneath the Sacred Temple. After the expedition has gone into the jungle to face unknown perils, Terry, Dr. Lee's son, and Pat Ryan, his friend, arrive in Wingpoo with important documents for Dr. Lee.
[first lines]
Say, Pat, do you think Dad will be sore at me for coming along?
It's a little late to be worrying about that now, Terry. You know, your father will be so happy to see you that he won't think about bawling you out until later.
Which way did Dr. Lee go?
I don't know. You don't leave any forwarding address when you into *that* jungle.
Pardon me, my name is Harris. Did you have any luck with the governor?
Yeah - all bad.
[translating an ancient scroll]
The voice of Mara...
Mara is the sun god in the court of the Temple of the Dawn.
The very spot I was heading for!
Yes, yes - that is the Dragon Lady's temple. Read on, Doctor.

The anger of Mara will be visited upon his people. War, pestilence, famine will humble them until the virtues of man are restored. Then will Mara speak and lead his people to the path of eternal glory.
Wonderful, Doctor, wonderful. That tells me much; the very thing the natives have been waiting for. That is their legend - that one day Mara will talk. All will be easy now. I will make Mara talk.
If I can make the god of the natives talk, I can control them through their superstition.
For what reason?
In some secret place in the Temple of the Dawn, there are stored all the treasures of a great civilization which prospered here thousands of years ago.
It was to uncover records of that civilization that I came here, but I am definitely not interested in treasure.

Nonsense, Doctor. We are all interested in obtaining great wealth. The Dragon Lady has the temple and I am not able to decipher the scrolls and tablets which undoubtedly lead to the treasure. That is where you come in.
[Terry and Pat find Nomandie at the bottom of a deep pit]
Normandie! How did you get down there?
Oh, look out! The gorilla is lurking nearby.
C'mon, Pat. We'll get something to get her out.
[to Normandie in the pit]
Don't go away!
Don't go away?
Connie and Big Stoop will take you to Wingpoo and your father. They can get through safely.
But we can't leave you and Terry out here alone. Let me go with you.
Oh, no. Girls handicap us men. Pat and I have got to get my dad.
I know you're right, but...
Be careful. One false step will mean certain death!
I have another plan, and I think it will work.
We'll try anything - won't we, Pat?
Anything as long as it promises action.
[Big Stoop, a magician, has managed to slip out of the ropes that bound his wrists]
Hey, you! Put your hands behind you. You show me tricks, will you? Now listen all of you...
[pats his pistol]
...I got six tricks in here and if you start anything, I'll show you every one of 'em.
I hate to be such a bother.
Oh, you're no bother. Pat likes you around.
Did you get to Pat and Terry in time to warn them?
Oh, no. They got there first and break phonograph record all to pieces.
Good!
Then they go to Fang's headquarters and blow it up. Bang!
Are they all right?
Now they go to Fang's hideout and blow it up. Bigger bang!
My people, evil has departed. Thanks to our good friends, our enemies are destroyed. Our god is ours again. I, your queen, promise you that all is well. Go to your homes in peace.
[last lines]
Terry, what's the matter with you?
Aw, shucks, Pat. There ain't gonna be any more fun around here. There's no one left to fight!
